title: Resume
text:
Projects

Machine Learning Project (New York University)
March 2025 – April 2025
- Built and evaluated classification models (Random Forest, Decision Trees, Logistic Regression, Naïve Bayes Classification) to predict trust levels in neighborhoods using demographic and perception survey data.
- Achieved 75.6% model accuracy; evaluated performance using confusion matrices, precision/recall, and kappa statistics.
- Conducted feature‐importance analysis to interpret key predictors, including income level, civic participation, and neighborhood safety.


Performance Measurement: Business Presentation (New York University)
September 2024 – December 2024
- Analyzed a tech company’s performance management system, including appraisal tools, evaluation criteria, and 360-degree feedback.
- Assessed links between performance ratings and outcomes like pay, development, and promotion.
- Proposed improvements using Behaviorally Anchored Rating Scales (BARS) and best practices to enhance fairness and consistency.
- Recommended manager training using the 70-20-10 model and delivered findings in a team presentation.


Keystone Case Competition (New York University)
October 2024
- Served as the leadership expert on a cross‐functional team in a university-level consulting competition.
- Analyzed a human resource management problem for a client, applying change-management frameworks to assess workplace challenges and suggest actionable solutions.
- Collaborated to identify key issues and develop a comprehensive strategy based on qualitative and quantitative analysis.
- Presented findings to a panel of industry experts, integrating both data‐driven insights and practical recommendations.


Employee Training in Organizations: Case Study Presentation (New York University)
January 2024 – May 2024
- Conducted a comprehensive needs assessment for training programs, identifying KSAOs required by physicians and medical staff to leverage AI in diagnostics and patient care.
- Developed customized training environments, incorporating AI fundamentals and ethical/legal guidelines tailored for healthcare.
- Created innovative learning methods (VR simulations, live webinars, e-learning platforms) to ensure effective knowledge transfer.
- Established a structured evaluation plan to measure training success via direct observation, feedback loops, and on-the-job assessments.

title: Resume
text:
Research Experience

Research Project: Factors Affecting Employee Perceptions of Professional Development in a Remote Work Setting (New York University)
January 2024 – May 2024
- Designed the research study and created a questionnaire targeting variables related to professional development and remote work.
- Performed statistical analysis (Descriptive Statistics, Individual t-tests, ANOVA, Correlation, Regression) in R to examine relationships between variables.
- Presented findings and recommendations to improve training and mentoring initiatives aimed at enhancing employee satisfaction and retention.


Dissertation: Impact of Work-Life Balance on Employee Turnover Intentions And Determining Factors Causing Job Dissatisfaction (Pandit Deendayal Energy University)
January 2023 – May 2023
- Designed the research study and crafted a questionnaire measuring work-life balance, job satisfaction, and turnover intentions.
- Conducted statistical analysis (Descriptive Statistics, ANOVA, Correlation, Regression) in Excel to evaluate the relationship between work-life balance factors and employee retention.
- Presented findings and recommendations to the dissertation panel, emphasizing practical implications for organizational policy and employee well-being.

title: Home
text: Mission: My goal is to help translate employee and organizational data into evidence‐based, people‐centric strategies that drive performance, engagement, and sustainable change. By combining rigorous analytics with insights from Industrial and Organizational Psychology, I design evidence‐based interventions that boost individual well‐being, strengthen team collaboration, and align leadership practices with organizational goals. Ultimately, my mission is to foster a culture of continuous learning and innovation so companies can achieve sustainable performance gains, higher engagement, and inclusive workplaces.

title: Home
text:
About Me

Graduated with Master’s in Industrial & Organizational Psychology from New York University, where I specialize in combining qualitative research, advanced statistical analysis, and machine‐learning techniques to solve real‐world business problems.


Before NYU, I earned my B.A. (Honors) in Psychology from Pandit Deendayal Energy University in India, where I graduated in May 2023. My undergraduate thesis explored factors affecting work‐life balance and turnover intentions, laying the groundwork for my passion in aligning organizational policy with employee well‐being.

title: Projects
text:
Below are a few highlights of my consulting, research, and capstone work. Click any link to open the full PDF.

Boeing Cultural & Leadership Transformation
Dec 2024
Diagnosed leadership and cultural breakdowns after the 737 Max crashes; proposed a mission overhaul, ethics committee, and KPI framework to rebuild trust.
Listen Wellness: EAP Business Plan
Dec 2024
Developed a full business plan targeting India’s manufacturing workforce with market analysis, funding projections, and ROI metrics (e.g., 20% absenteeism reduction).
Remote Work Professional Development Study
May 2024
Surveyed 35 remote employees in R; ran t-tests, ANOVA, correlation, regression—recommended virtual mentorship programs and feedback loops.
M&A Case Study: GRS & MejorVida
Nov 2023
Diagnosed cultural distance in a cross-border acquisition; used McKinsey’s model to design integration workshops, 360-feedback, and a phased OD plan.
Goldman Sachs: Organizational Change Case Study
Dec 2023
Used the Burke-Litwin Model to analyze external pressures, leadership, and cultural dynamics at Goldman Sachs. Proposed OD interventions using Kotter’s Change Model to improve retention, reduce burnout, and realign the firm’s high-pressure culture with Gen Z workforce expectations.
Dissertation: Work-Life Balance & Turnover Intentions
May 2023
Analyzed work-life factors via descriptive stats, ANOVA, correlation, regression in Excel; offered recommendations to reduce turnover and boost well-being.
